p: Bacterial strains used in this work ( Table 9) were grown in Brain Heart Infusion broth (BHI, Oxoid, UK). Biofilm formation was assessed in static conditions. Planktonic cultures were grown in flasks under vigorous agitation (180 rpm) at 37 Â°C. In particular, S. aureus ATCC 6538P (6538P) and S. aureus ATCC 25923 (25923) are reference strains for antimicrobial testing; S. epidermidis RP62A (RP62A) is a reference strain isolated from infected catheter, while S. epidermidis O-47 (O-47) is a clinical isolate strong biofilm producer strain characterized by a genomic mutation in agr locus [ 42].
